usefulItems: jug, sealable storage container, meat mallet or rolling pin, toothpick, refrigerator
title: Chicken involtini with sun-dried tomato pesto

ingredients.content: 40 g Parmesan cheese, crust removed and cut into cubes (3 cm)
70 g mozzarella cheese, cut into pieces (4 cm)
2 sprig fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only, plus extra for garnishing
1 pinch ground black pepper, to taste

preparations.content: Place a jug onto mixing bowl lid, then weigh olive oil into it. Set jug aside until required.
Place Parmesan and garlic into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add pine nuts and sun-dried tomatoes and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>, or until a chunky consistency is achieved. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Mix <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>, slowly pouring oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle into mixing bowl. Transfer pesto into a sealable storage container and refrigerate until ready to use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place mozzarella into mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic and parsley into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add eggs, salt, pepper, breadcrumbs and 4 tbsp of the reserved sun-dried tomato pesto and combine <b>30 sec/speed 5<b>.

Using a meat mallet or rolling pin, pound chicken tenderloins to tenderise and flatten. Distribute breadcrumb mixture evenly over  tenderloins, then top each tenderloin with two spinach leaves and a sprinkle of reserved mozzarella.
Roll tenderloins up to enclose filling and secure ends with toothpicks. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Arrange chicken involtini in the simmering basket and Varoma dish, then set simmering basket and Varoma aside until ready to cook.
Place garlic and brown onion into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté <b>3 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.

Add tomato passata (purée) and 1 tbsp of the reserved sun-dried tomato pesto to mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket with involtini, then place Varoma dish with remaining involtini into position. Steam <b>20-25 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>, or until chicken is cooked through.

Once cooked, set Varoma aside and remove simmering basket with aid of spatula. Place sauce onto plates or into serving dish, top with chicken involtini and serve immediately garnished with fresh parsley.

hintsAndTricks: Vegetables of choice can be steamed on the Varoma tray at the same time as the chicken involtini if desired. This may affect the cooking time for the chicken so check your chicken is cooked through and extend cooking time accordingly if required.

To store leftover sun-dried tomato pesto, transfer into a sealable storage jar or container, then top with a thin layer of olive oil until pesto is cover. Place into the refrigerator to store until use.
